page.title: 01NEWCHURCH & ARRETON VALLEY
page.content: The Newchurch and Arreton valley is very fertile land hence its use as the island's major growing area. Many acres are under glass and there is a flourishing garden centre industr4y. The area is particularly rated for its growing of sweetcorn and garlic and is being developed as the major garlic centre in the country. There are several buildings of historical value and they are open to view by the public. Original crafts can be seen at the Craft Village and Newchurch pottery and there are several interesting Public Houses to be visited. A popular camping site is situated on the outskirts of Newchurch village_ perfectly positioned as a base from which to appreciate the beauties of the island.
